description: Single storey side and rear extension with 4x rooflights and green roof, flank and rear ground floor elevation black aluminium  windows and side access door, sliding doors to ground floor rear elevation, new landscaping with permeable paving to rear and to the front drive area, the replacement of roof concrete tiles with new slate roof tiles, and incorporation of a single rear facing roof light together with the replacement of front facing timber windows with new double glazed timber windows to match original design, and the replacement of rear facing first and loft floor windows with new black aluminium windows and reinstatement of original timber balustrade to 1st floor front bay window.
decision_conditions: The proposed development, by virtue of its height, width and bulk would harm the character and appearance of the host building, the surrounding area of which it forms part and this part of the Hadley Wood Conservation Area, which is not outweighed by any planning benefits, contrary to Sections 12 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3, D4, D5, D8, HC1 of the London Plan (2021), CP30 and CP31 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), DMD6, DMD8, DMD11, DMD12, DMD13, DMD14, DMD37 and DMD44 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014) and Policies HW 1, HW 5 and HW 12 of the Hadley Wood Neighbourhood Plan (2023) the Hadley Wood Conservation Area Character Appraisal (2016) and Hadley Wood Conservation Area Management Proposals (2015).
